Package edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.course

Class Course

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.course.Activity
      • edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.course.Course
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Conflict
    public class Course
extends Activity
    Course class for WolfScheduler, use to create Course objects. A Course object consists of a name, title, section, credits instructor id, meeting days, start time and end time. Extends the Activity class. Contains overridden methods from the Activity class.
    Author:
    Sanjana Cheerla

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Course​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String title, java.lang.String section, int credits, java.lang.String instructorId, java.lang.String meetingDays)
      Creates a Course with the given name, title, section, credits, instructorId, and meetingDays for courses that are arranged.
      Course​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String title, java.lang.String section, int credits, java.lang.String instructorId, java.lang.String meetingDays, int startTime, int endTime)
      Constructs a Course object with values for all fields.

        public void setSection​(java.lang.String section)
        Sets the Course's section. If the section number is not 3 numbers long, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        section - The section to set
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the section is not 3 numbers long

      • getCredits

        The number of credits of the Course

      • setCredits

        public void setCredits​(int credits)
        Sets the Course's credits. If the course credits is not a digit, or credits is less than 1 or greater than 5 an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        credits - The number credits to set for the course
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If credits is less than 1 or greater than 5

      • getInstructorId

        public void setInstructorId​(java.lang.String instructorId)
        Sets the Course's instructorId. If instructorId is null or empty an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        instructorId - The instructorId to set
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If instructorId is null or empty.

      • setMeetingDays

        public void setMeetingDays​(java.lang.String meetingDays)
        Sets the Course's meetingDays. If the meetingDays contains any other characters than "M,T,W,H,F,A", an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. If there is an "A" it must be the only character or else, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Overrides:
        setMeetingDays in class Activity
        Parameters:
        meetingDays - The meetingDays to set
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If meetingDays is null or empty, and if the meetingDays are invalid meaning that it must have "M" "T" "W" "T" "F" as a combination of strings and no other characters. If there is an "A" it must be the only character.

      • isDuplicate

        public boolean isDuplicate​(Activity activity)
        Checks to see if the activity is a duplicate of the course. The activity is a duplicate if it is an instance of Course and has the same name.
        Specified by:
        isDuplicate in class Activity
        Parameters:
        activity - the activity to be checked if it is a duplicate
        Returns:
        true if the activity is a duplicate, false if it is not a duplicate
